trans-unit.source: In this step, you test the availability group listener using a client application running on the same network.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you test the availability group listener using a client application running on the same network.

trans-unit.source: For client connectivity, please note the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: For client connectivity, please note the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: Client connections to the listener must come from machines that reside in a different cloud service than the one that hosts the AlwaysOn Availability replicas.
trans-unit.target: Client connections to the listener must come from machines that reside in a different cloud service than the one that hosts the AlwaysOn Availability replicas.

trans-unit.source: If the AlwaysOn replicas are in different subnets, clients must specify "MultisubnetFailover=True" in the connection string.
trans-unit.target: If the AlwaysOn replicas are in different subnets, clients must specify "MultisubnetFailover=True" in the connection string.

trans-unit.source: This results in parallel connection attempts to replicas in the different subnets.
trans-unit.target: This results in parallel connection attempts to replicas in the different subnets.

trans-unit.source: Note that this scenario includes a cross-region AlwaysOn Availability Group deployment.
trans-unit.target: Note that this scenario includes a cross-region AlwaysOn Availability Group deployment.

trans-unit.source: One example would be to connect to the listener from one of the VMs in the same Azure VNet (but not one that hosts a replica).
trans-unit.target: One example would be to connect to the listener from one of the VMs in the same Azure VNet (but not one that hosts a replica).

trans-unit.source: An easy way to complete this test is to try to connect SSMS to the availability group listener.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to complete this test is to try to connect SSMS to the availability group listener.

trans-unit.source: Another simple method is to run [SQLCMD.exe](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms162773.aspx) as follows:
trans-unit.target: Another simple method is to run [SQLCMD.exe](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ms162773.aspx) as follows:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the EndpointPort value is 1433, it is not required to specify it in the call.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the EndpointPort value is 1433, it is not required to specify it in the call.

trans-unit.source: The previous call also assumes that the client machine is joined to the same domain and that the caller has been granted permissions on the database using windows authentication.
trans-unit.target: The previous call also assumes that the client machine is joined to the same domain and that the caller has been granted permissions on the database using windows authentication.

trans-unit.source: When testing the listener, be sure to fail over the availability group to make sure that clients can connect to the listener across failovers.
trans-unit.target: When testing the listener, be sure to fail over the availability group to make sure that clients can connect to the listener across failovers.
